attributes.action: Cease payments to failed Asylum Seekers
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/asylum-support/what-youll-get?fbclid=IwAR3Ts1kLpn2I_Iax-nOQsHJLqWCB_7ebqOGLr3W4EmoVGHvsRCtmNaaUz-w
Failed Asylum Seekers will be given somewhere to live plus
£35.39 per person on a payment card for food, clothing and toiletries. They should be returned to their own countries immediately after they fail their asylum claim!
attributes.background: The UK Government is using Tax Payers cash for failed Asylum Seekers. They are also housed.  TheTax paid by the British people should be going towards housing our own British people You have NEVER been mandated to do this!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

If someone has been refused asylum in the UK, they can ask the Government for support if they are homeless and can show there's a reason why they cannot leave the UK yet:

https://www.gov.uk/asylum-support/eligibility

You could start a new petition explaining clearly how you would like the Government or Parliament to change the current rules.
